pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.2_0: The account of the nun Analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.11_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.13_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.14.1_0: ‘If a nun wears jewellery, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six were wearing jewellery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.4_0: “How can nuns wear jewellery? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.5_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.6_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.7_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear jewellery?” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.6_0: what goes on the head, what goes around the neck, what goes on the hands, what goes on the feet, what goes around the hips.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.1.8_0: if she uses it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.2_0: if she wears it because she is ill;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.4_0: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc87:2.2.5_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
